title: Halfords Advanced Socket and Rachet Spanner Set

posts.content:
Claushema wrote:
Rang up a Halfords over here in Holland this morning only to discover the whole chain is bankrupt. Who knew?


Different company mate

Halfords group PLC is an FT 250 UK Listed company, consisting of halfords ltd (retail stores), Halfords autocentres (used to be Nationwide autocentres) And Boardman Bikes. No connection with anything outside the UK and Ireland now (did have some stores in Poland and Czech Republic a few years back, but now closed).

Shame to hear another company going to the wall

Be careful. I have one in the bus for an emergency, I had a spanner replaced under warranty......eventually after being spoken too like I was some kind of idiot and had to haggle at that, and the hinges on the box broke a few days of ownership and this isn't covered under warranty.

Its not a bad set sat it the bus but better money needs to be spent if in use in the garage frequently.

Just my opinion.
Snap on sell a blue point service set 100 piece for £170, more costly but a very nice set.
